body: I've merged the changes. Please close the PR (the asfgit only close PR with pushes that go to master branch).
Could you check your Git identity via `git config --global user.name` and `git config --global user.email` ?
i've now set up my twill git repo to have serranom and my github email.  so future commits will be correct.
Cool! Looking forward to  them =)
LGTM

@yufeldman : Could you kindly add in the summary of the PR the summary of the approach you are taking to fix the issue?

Will help with the review to compare expectation vs implementation.
The approach seems fine. Just couple comments about the naming and not to allow `null` ratio.
LGTM. Will merge it when build pass.
@chtyim I was asking concern about the selection of double vs float

Ah, Yulia just replied on JIRA that we HAD ALREADY used double for the ratio (not sure why) but this PR just continuing the existing data format.

+1 then
LGTM
LGTM
Hi @chtyim looks like there is only 1 commit for this PR?
I squashed them after getting LGTM to prepare for the merge
Seems like the github sync is lagging. I merged this change about 6 hours ago
Force push a change to trigger travis build again.
Ah ok
This PR contains both style and functional change, could you help tell a bit where the important  changes happen?
As said in the description, you will see the important changes when ignoring white space changes
Ah, yes, sorry, I thought I added the ignore white spaces when load the files changes view.
LGTM
Thanks for the review.
LGTM
@anew Thanks for the review. Addressed comments, please have another look.
LGTM
I did a pass and add some comments. Mostly kind of concern of multiple ways to check whether log collection is disabled or not.
@hsaputra Thanks for the review. Please see my replies.

+1 for correctness

I just added suggestion of style of return null vs declarative check by caller to determine if logging collection is disabled.
Thank @hsaputra for the review. Merging the change.

@serranom True. We can also try to get it via the `LocationFactory` from the application location, however it won't really make the code easier to understand (there would be unwrapping and `instanceof` check)
LGTM. Merging.
IMO this is the cleaner, if verbose, way. LGTM +1
LGTM
This replaces #45 due to accidentally deleting the branch.
Changes LGTM, may I ask where do we set the logback if it is overriden by user?
For AM, currently it is not settable. For Runnable containers, user can add as resources / localize a `logback.xml` file and specify it in the classpath.
I see. LGTM
I tried to create a unit test using MiniKdc, but seems like I hit this bug https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDFS-9213
just a couple comments
1 minor comment; remainder LGTM.
LGTM
LGTM
LGTM

Thank you, @serranom for your comment. Is there any way to set "right" order of imports in IDEA? I've imported settings from HowToContribute page, but it seems, that it still wants to move imports.

Ok, seems, that I found Settings | Code style | Java | Scheme -> Twill
Reverted reformatting
LGTM.

One quick question, does Kafka 0.10 client works with older version of Kafka server?

Also, ideally we should separate out all these Kafka related dependencies in a separate twill module, otherwise making it compatible with different Scala version would be quite difficult.
LGTM
@anew Thanks for the review.
LGTM
squashed

One question about change form using BufferedReader,  but looks good.

If passes tests +1
LGTM

I added a few omissions and corrected the parent  `pom.xml` from my original submission. Now the new code is actually being used and I have updated the default target to Hadoop 2.6 and removed the generic `hadoop.version` as suggested.

Thank you for the super fast code review @serranom! I think all comments have been addressed and the code should be complete now. Please let me know if you see anything else necessary. It is great working with Twill! Hopefully I can provide some other ideas as I work with it.
The change looks mostly ok to me, except for the change in the pom.xml profile.

Hi @chtyim, thank you for the review. Could you please expand on what you see concerning in the `pom.xml`? For reference, I need to provide a 2.6 target as it is the first version to provide the `ContainerId.fromString()` API.
Changes LGTM.

+1
LGTM

I've addressed the comments and fixed one more issue (one deletion failure, if the node not exist, we can just go ahead and recreate the node instead of failing).

 Also refactored the callback code a bit to try to make it cleaner.
Can you change the commit message to mention the race condition fixes?
Updated commit message to include more details about the fixes.
seems code style check failed,will try to open a new pull request
add new code, modify the code as you suggested and add the HAutils method judgement.
